title: The Overlap Zone
description: Understanding the overlap between meditation tech and cyberdelics, and identifying the tipping point.

sections.title: Significant Common Ground
sections.content: Meditation tech and cyberdelics have substantial overlap. Many apps use technology to support contemplation. The boundaries aren't always clear, and that's okay.

sections.title: Simple Meditation Apps
sections.content: Apps like Headspace/Calm are valuable for mindfulness but typically don't use immersive VR or biofeedback to intentionally create altered states. They are meditation tech, not cyberdelic.

sections.title: VR Meditation With Biofeedback

media.alt: Venn Diagram: Meditation Tech vs. Cyberdelics overlap

sections.content: When practice moves into immersive VR with biofeedback that responds to your state, enabling profound altered states, you've crossed into cyberdelic territory. Tech becomes a catalyst, not just a delivery mechanism.

sections.title: The Intensity Question
sections.content: It's a spectrum. How immersive is it? How sophisticated is the biofeedback? How profound are the intended states? The more intense and intentional, the more cyberdelic.

sections.title: Both Are Valid
sections.content: This isn't about one being better. Simple apps serve millions. Cyberdelics offer deeper exploration. The field benefits from tools at different intensity levels.

content.notes: Interactive drag-and-drop categorization into 'Meditation Tech', 'Overlap', or 'Cyberdelic'. Development pending.

questions.question:
Question 1

What pushes a meditation app from basic tech into cyberdelic territory?

synthesis.q1_a: Incorrect. Quantity isn't the factor. Immersion and intent matter.
synthesis.q1_c: Incorrect. Cost is irrelevant. Technology and intent define the category.
synthesis.q1_d: Incorrect. Growth in user base doesn't change the design category.
synthesis.q1_b:
✓ Correct!

Immersive VR, biofeedback loops, and exploratory intent are the markers of cyberdelic territory.

questions.question:
Question 2

Where would a VR meditation environment without biofeedback fall?

synthesis.q2_a: Incorrect. VR adds immersion that moves it beyond basic apps towards the overlap.
synthesis.q2_c: Incorrect. Without biofeedback/interaction, it likely hasn't crossed fully into independent cyberdelic territory.
synthesis.q2_b:
✓ Quiz Complete!

It sits in the overlap—more immersive than apps, but less integrated than full cyberdelic protocols.
